text: was a after Katei and before En'ō. This period spanned the years from November 1238 to April 1239.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Ryakunin" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 796. The reigning emperor was .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du Japon, pp. 242-244; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 227. ==Events of the Ryakunin Era== * 1238 (Ryakunin 1, 1st month): Kūjo Yoritsune travelled from Kamakura to Kyoto with Hōjō Yasutoki.Titsingh, p. 243. * 1238 (Ryakunin 1, 2nd month): Yoritsune began to live in his new palace at Rokuhara.Titsingh, p. 244. * 1238 (Ryakunin 1, 10th month): Yoritsune travelled from Kyoto to Kamakura. ==Related pages == * Kamakura period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Ryakunin 1st 2nd 1238 1239 Preceded by: Katei Era or nengō: Ryakunin Succeeded by: En'ō Category:Japanese eras Category:1238 Category:1239 Category:1230s in Japan
title: Ryakunin
